Application Performance Monitoring (APM).description: Provides end-to-end distributed tracing to monitor application performance, visualize request flows across services, and identify performance bottlenecks in real-time. This includes automatic instrumentation for a wide range of popular Ruby frameworks and libraries.

Continuous Profiler.description: Analyzes code-level performance in production environments with minimal overhead. It identifies CPU, memory, and wall-time-intensive code paths to help optimize resource usage and reduce infrastructure costs.

files.description: This document provides development notes and design specifications for the continuous profiler within the Datadog Ruby tracer, detailing its components, initialization, runtime execution, and specific features like GVL profiling.

This file implements thread-specific CPU time retrieval by leveraging `pthread_getcpuclockid` and `clock_gettime` to obtain a thread's CPU clock ID and its current CPU time, respectively. It includes a self-test for its pthread ID mapping.
This file defines structures and functions for obtaining CPU time identifiers and CPU time in nanoseconds for threads, likely within a Ruby environment, using OS-specific clock IDs.

Declares a C function for requesting an action within an idle sampling helper. This function likely facilitates communication and triggering operations related to idle sampling in a native extension context.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation for CPU clock ID retrieval functions. It acts as a fallback for systems that do not support `pthread_getcpuclockid`.

This header file declares functions for a native extension to initialize, check the status of major garbage collection, and set metadata for GC profiling.

This file defines the `heap_recorder` C struct and its associated functions, which are responsible for tracking live Ruby heap objects to facilitate the creation of a live heap profile, including managing allocation recordings, sampling, and iterating over tracked objects.

This header file provides helper functions for the Datadog Ruby profiler extension, facilitating conversions between Ruby data types and native C types, particularly for string interning and value type identification within the Datadog profiling library.

OpenTelemetry Integration.description: Provides seamless interoperability with the OpenTelemetry standard. It allows applications using OpenTelemetry to send traces and metrics to Datadog, unifying observability data in a single platform.

files.description: This document describes how to integrate OpenTelemetry with the Datadog Ruby tracer, covering configuration for tracing and metrics, supported features, and limitations of the integration.

It allows Datadog traces to store and retrieve OpenTelemetry context values and integrates with the OpenTelemetry Context's attach/detach mechanisms.

Dynamic Instrumentation & Live Debugging.description: Allows developers to inject logging and capture variable snapshots from live, running applications without redeploying code. It helps diagnose production issues by providing real-time insights into code behavior.

Crash Tracking.description: Monitors and reports unexpected exits and crashes of the Ruby virtual machine. This provides deep insights into low-level stability issues that are not captured by standard application error tracking.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Buffer::Random` class, verifying its functionality for adding, retrieving, and managing items with and without size limits, as well as its closure behavior. It also includes performance benchmarks for `push` and `concat` operations under various overflow conditions.
This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Buffer::ThreadSafe` class. It verifies the thread-safety and performance characteristics of the buffer implementation.
This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Remote::Dispatcher` class, verifying its functionality in dispatching remote configuration changes based on matching rules.

This file provides Ruby class and module definitions for the DDSketch Protocol Buffer messages, automatically generated from the `ddsketch.proto` schema. It enables Ruby applications to serialize and deserialize DDSketch data structures.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Transport::Transport` class, verifying its functionality related to API version management, fallback mechanisms, and handling of downgrade conditions during communication.
This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Transport::HTTP::Adapters::Registry` class, ensuring its `get` and `set` methods correctly manage HTTP adapter registrations.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Transport::HTTP::Adapters::Net::Response` class, verifying its ability to parse HTTP responses, extract data, and correctly identify various HTTP status conditions.
This file contains RSpec tests for `Datadog::Core::Transport::HTTP::API::Map`, verifying that it behaves as both a `Hash` and incorporates `Datadog::Core::Transport::HTTP::API::Fallbacks`.
This RSpec test file verifies the functionality of `Datadog::Core::Transport::HTTP::API::Instance`, focusing on its initialization, header handling logic during HTTP calls, and the `encoder` method.

This RSpec test file verifies the functionality of `Datadog::Core::Transport::HTTP::API::Endpoint`, ensuring it correctly initializes with a verb and path, and applies these attributes to an HTTP environment object when called.
This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Transport::HTTP::API::Fallbacks` module. It verifies the functionality of methods for managing and merging fallback definitions.
This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Utils::Sequence` class, verifying its ability to generate incremental sequences of values, handle custom seeds and blocks, and reset its state.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Utils::OnlyOnce` utility class, ensuring that its `run` method executes a given block only a single time and that its `ran?` method correctly reports its execution status.
This file contains RSpec tests for the FNV-1 64-bit hash function utility, ensuring it computes correct and consistent hashes for various string inputs.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Utils::Time` utility module, verifying its functions for retrieving monotonic timestamps, measuring execution time, and converting time objects to UTC epoch nanoseconds.
Tests the `Datadog::Core::Utils::Forking` module, verifying its behavior related to process forking, including how it manages fork PIDs and executes callbacks in forked processes.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Utils::Url.filter_basic_auth` method. It verifies that the method correctly removes basic authentication credentials from URLs across various protocols and formats.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Utils::Duration` class, specifically its `.call` method. It verifies that the method correctly parses duration strings (e.g., '1h', '10m', '1.5s') into different time units (seconds, milliseconds, microseconds, nanoseconds), handling both integer and float inputs with and without suffixes.
This file contains RSpec tests for the `truncate_in_middle` utility method in `Datadog::Core::Utils::Truncation`, verifying its behavior across various string lengths and truncation scenarios.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Utils::AtForkMonkeyPatch` module, which verifies that the module correctly applies monkey patches to Ruby's forking mechanisms (`Kernel.fork`, `Process.daemon`, `Process._fork`) to execute custom callbacks in child processes.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Utils::Hash::CaseInsensitiveWrapper` class. It verifies that the wrapper correctly provides case-insensitive access and key checking for hash-like objects, along with other utility methods.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Utils::OnlyOnceSuccessful` utility, which ensures a block of code is executed at most once successfully or a limited number of times upon successive failures.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Utils::SafeDup` module, verifying its `frozen_or_dup` and `frozen_dup` methods for various data types (String, Hash, Boolean, Array, Numeric) to ensure they handle frozen objects and return appropriate duplicates.
This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Utils::Network` module, verifying its methods for extracting and normalizing IP addresses from HTTP request headers and general IP strings.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Workers::IntervalLoop` module, verifying its behavior when included in a worker, specifically focusing on loop execution, stopping mechanisms, and back-off strategies for interval-based tasks.

This RSpec test file verifies the functionality of the `Datadog::Core::Workers::Queue` module, ensuring its queuing mechanism for workers behaves as expected. It tests methods like `perform`, `enqueue`, `dequeue`, and `work_pending?`.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Workers::Polling` module, verifying its behavior as a worker component. It specifically tests the worker's lifecycle, including starting, stopping, graceful shutdown, forced termination, and handling of race conditions during concurrent operations, as well as its enabled/disabled state.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Telemetry::Component` class, verifying its initialization, configuration-driven behavior, lifecycle methods, and its ability to emit various telemetry events (e.g., app closing, integrations change, client configuration change, endpoints loaded, logs) through a worker.
This file provides RSpec helper methods for easily setting up and tearing down WEBrick HTTP servers, including those using Unix Domain Sockets, within tests.
This file provides helper methods for HTTP-related operations, primarily for test environments. It includes a utility to wait until an HTTP server becomes available and returns a 200 OK status.
This file enables RSpec examples to run in a forked process, isolating tests and ensuring all hooks and results are correctly communicated back to the parent process via inter-process communication.

Provides utility functions for Rack-related operations, specifically converting HTTP header names to their Rack environment key equivalents. This module is likely used in testing contexts within the `dd-trace-rb` repository.
Provides utility methods for network configuration, such as finding available TCP ports and constructing agent URLs from environment variables, primarily to support testing scenarios.
This file provides helper methods for isolating thread creation within a specific `ThreadGroup`, primarily to aid in identifying and debugging 'leaky' threads during testing or development.

This file defines `SynchronizationHelpers`, a module providing utility methods for RSpec tests. It includes helpers for executing code in forked processes with output capture and timeouts, and a general method for waiting until a specific condition is met.

This file defines the `Datadog::Kit` module, which provides public-facing APIs for higher-level, user-facing features not belonging to a specific product, and loads its sub-modules like `Datadog::Kit::Identity`.

This file defines an HTTP POST endpoint responsible for preparing and sending data, likely traces or metrics, to the Datadog backend. It configures the request's content type using an encoder and includes serialized Datadog tags in the query parameters.

This file defines a `ThreadSafeRef` class that provides a thread-safe mechanism to manage references to an object, ensuring it is only finalized when its reference count drops to zero, especially when the object might be replaced or marked for finalization in another thread.

This file defines a utility module for coercing various Ruby objects into a hash format. It attempts to use common serialization methods like `as_json`, `to_hash`, or `to_h` to achieve this conversion.
This file provides a utility module for parsing URL-encoded payloads (query strings or form data) into a hash, handling duplicate keys by converting values into arrays.

This file provides functionality for managing and logging deprecated operations within the Datadog Ruby library. It tracks and logs deprecation warnings, ensuring they are only reported once per unique key.

This file defines a custom Datadog logger (`Datadog::Core::Logger`) that extends Ruby's standard `Logger`, adding enhancements such as a default program name and including stack trace information for debug or error messages.

This file defines a `KnuthSampler` class that provides deterministic sampling decisions using a Knuth multiplicative hash algorithm, ensuring consistent sampling based on an input value and a given rate.
This file provides a utility for chunking a list of elements into batches, ensuring that the aggregated 'size' of elements in each chunk does not exceed a specified maximum.

This file defines encoding functionalities for Datadog Core, providing interfaces and implementations for JSON and MessagePack serialization, deserialization, and joining of data, primarily for Agent transport.

This file defines an abstract `HeaderCollection` class and a concrete `HashHeaderCollection` implementation, facilitating standardized, case-insensitive access to headers stored in a Ruby hash. It provides a common interface for retrieving header values, particularly useful for testing or internal data handling.
This file defines a base `Worker` class within the `Datadog::Core` module. It encapsulates a task, provided as a block during initialization, which can then be executed via the `perform` method.
This file defines the `Pin` class, which allows attaching custom metadata or configurations to arbitrary Ruby objects by dynamically adding accessor methods to them.
This file defines abstract and concrete implementations of rate limiting functionality, including a Token Bucket algorithm and an unlimited rate limiter.
This file implements a semaphore synchronization primitive using Ruby's `Mutex` and `ConditionVariable`.
This file contains a collection of low-level, general-purpose utility methods for string manipulation, encoding, and other common tasks within the Datadog Core module.

This file defines a thread-safe buffer implementation (`Datadog::Core::Buffer::ThreadSafe`) that uses a mutex to ensure concurrent safety. It is recommended for non-CRuby environments to store and manage objects with a maximum size.

Implements a thread-safe buffer specifically for CRuby environments, leveraging CRuby's array operation thread-safety to handle concurrent writes without explicit locks. It prioritizes performance and memory efficiency by replacing random items when full, instead of blocking.
This file defines a buffer class that stores objects up to a maximum size. When the buffer is full, it discards a random existing object to accommodate new items.
This file defines a `Worker` class that executes a provided block of code at a specified interval on a separate thread, managing its lifecycle (start, stop).

This file defines classes for managing remote configuration content within the Datadog tracer. It includes a `Content` class to store individual configuration items (data, path, digests, apply state) and a `ContentList` class to manage collections of these content items.
This file defines HTTP transport clients and endpoints specifically for sending telemetry data to the Datadog agent or directly to the Datadog API.
Defines classes for packaging and transporting telemetry data within the Datadog Ruby tracer. It includes an `EncodedParcel` for telemetry payloads and a `Transport` class to send telemetry requests.

This file defines the base `Transport` class, responsible for managing and switching between different API versions for data transport. It handles API selection, client initialization, and provides mechanisms for API downgrades based on HTTP responses.

This file defines an abstract interface (`Response` module) for handling responses from a transport layer, providing methods to check response status and access the payload. It also includes a concrete implementation (`InternalErrorResponse`) for reporting internal errors within the transport.

This file defines an abstract `Parcel` module, serving as a data transfer object for generic data within the Datadog core transport layer. It provides a base interface for data that needs to be transported and encoded.

This file defines the HTTP transport component for Datadog's core library, registering various HTTP adapters (like Net::HTTP and Unix Socket) and providing a builder function to construct an HTTP transport instance with default headers.

This file defines a module `Datadog::Core::Transport::HTTP::Response` that wraps an HTTP response object from an adapter. It provides a standardized interface for accessing common response properties and status checks, delegating calls to the wrapped HTTP response.

This file defines a test adapter for Datadog's HTTP transport, allowing users to capture sent requests into a buffer and simulate specific HTTP responses. It's designed for testing purposes within the Datadog tracing library.

This file provides an HTTP transport adapter for Datadog that uses Unix domain sockets instead of standard TCP/IP for communication, allowing the Datadog agent to send traces and metrics over a local Unix socket.

This file defines a `Net::HTTP` adapter for Datadog's core transport layer, facilitating HTTP communication (GET/POST) with the agent by wrapping Ruby's standard `Net::HTTP` library and handling response processing.
This file defines the `Endpoint` class, representing a single HTTP API endpoint with its verb, path, and an optional encoder for request serialization.

This file defines a module that provides functionality for managing fallback API versions or configurations within the Datadog HTTP transport layer. It allows for adding and retrieving fallback settings for API calls.

This file defines the `Instance` class, which represents a configured HTTP API endpoint. It manages an HTTP adapter, endpoint-specific headers, and processes API calls by applying headers before delegating to the adapter.
Defines a `Map` class that stores a mapping of Datadog API versions to their respective routes or instances for HTTP transport. It extends `Hash` and includes fallback logic for API version handling.

This file monkey patches `Kernel#fork`, `Process#_fork`, and `Process#daemon` to provide an `at_fork` callback mechanism, allowing observability libraries to reinitialize after a process forks, particularly in multi-process Ruby applications.
This file defines utility methods for safely duplicating Ruby objects, particularly strings, by leveraging optimized freezing and duplication techniques to avoid unnecessary object allocations.
This file provides utility methods for processing URLs, specifically for filtering sensitive information such as basic authentication credentials.
This file provides utility methods for Base64 encoding and decoding within the Datadog Ruby core library, offering functions like `encode64`, `strict_encode64`, and `strict_decode64`.
Provides utility methods for truncating strings, specifically by truncating the middle part of a string if it exceeds a certain length.

This file provides common array-related utility functions, specifically a `filter_map` method that applies a block to each element and removes nil results, with optimizations for different Ruby versions and enumerable types.

This file defines a helper class `OnlyOnceSuccessful` that executes a block of code until it returns a truthy value (indicating success) or until a specified number of attempts are exhausted. It ensures that once successful, subsequent calls to `run` do not re-execute the block.
This file provides utility methods and classes for Ruby's `Hash` object, including compatibility refinements for `compact` and `compact!` methods, and a case-insensitive wrapper for hash access.
This file implements the FNV-1a 64-bit non-cryptographic hash function. It provides a utility method to compute an FNV hash for given input data.
This file defines a thread-safe utility class, `OnlyOnce`, designed to ensure that a given block of code is executed a maximum of one time across multiple calls.
Provides utility methods for parsing string representations of durations (e.g., '1h', '30m', '1.5s') into a numeric value, scaled to a specified base unit (e.g., seconds, milliseconds).

This file defines a utility class `Sequence` that generates a sequence of integer values. It can be initialized with a seed and an optional block for custom generation, and allows resetting the sequence to its initial state.

Provides utility functions for time-related operations, including getting current monotonic and wall clock time, measuring execution duration, and converting time to nanoseconds. It also offers mechanisms to override time providers for testing or specific needs.
This file provides utility functions for network operations, primarily focusing on extracting, cleaning, and validating IP addresses from request headers, and identifying global IP addresses.

Provides utility methods for detecting process forking and managing process IDs, ensuring that actions can be correctly performed or triggered after a fork event. It initializes objects with their current process ID to accurately track subsequent forks.
This module provides queue behavior for workers, enabling items to be enqueued and dequeued using an internal buffer. It also includes methods for checking work status and flushing the queue.
This module adds asynchronous threading capabilities to worker classes, enabling them to execute tasks in separate threads. It also includes logic to handle worker behavior when a process forks.
This module provides a mixin for Ruby workers, enabling them to execute tasks in a continuous loop with configurable intervals, back-off mechanisms, and graceful shutdown capabilities.
This is the primary helper file for a Rails application, intended to contain methods accessible across all views. Currently, it is empty, indicating no global helper methods have been defined yet.

This file defines a Ruby module `IntegrationHelper` that provides shared contexts and utility methods for integration tests. It includes helpers for making HTTP requests to a test server and logic to conditionally skip tests based on environment variables or Ruby platform constraints.

This directory is intended to house type signature files for the `datadog/core/runtime` component within the Datadog Ruby tracer. It defines the expected types and interfaces for the core runtime functionality, enhancing static analysis and type checking.

This directory is intended to house type signature files for utility modules and functions within the `Datadog::Core` namespace of the `dd-trace-rb` gem. These signatures, often used by tools like Sorbet, define the expected types for inputs and outputs of core utility methods, aiding static analysis and development. Although currently empty, its purpose is to ensure type safety and clarity for common helper functions.

This directory contains type signatures for HTTP transport mechanisms used in the Datadog core telemetry system. It defines the interfaces and structures for sending telemetry data over HTTP. As part of the `sig` directory, it ensures type safety for these transport components.

Feature Flag Observability.description: Integrates with feature flagging systems via the OpenFeature standard to monitor the impact and performance of feature releases. It links feature flag evaluations to user experience and backend performance.

files.description: This header file declares an initialization function for Ruby feature flag integration. It provides an API for C code to set up feature flag functionality within a Ruby module.

This file implements a Ruby C extension that provides an interface to the `libdatadog` feature flag evaluation (FFE) library. It allows Ruby applications to manage feature flag configurations and evaluate flag assignments based on a given context.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::OpenFeature` module, verifying its `enabled?` method and the behavior of its `engine` method under various configuration settings, including the availability of remote configuration.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::FeatureFlags` module, verifying its ability to load feature flag configurations from JSON and evaluate feature flag assignments based on provided context.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::OpenFeature::EvaluationEngine` class. It verifies the engine's behavior in fetching feature flag values under various conditions, including error handling, telemetry reporting, and reconfiguration scenarios.
Tests the `NoopEvaluator` in Datadog's OpenFeature integration, verifying that it returns a 'PROVIDER_NOT_READY' error and the fallback value when flag assignments are requested.

This RSpec test file verifies the functionality of `Datadog::OpenFeature::ResolutionDetails.build_error`, ensuring it correctly constructs error resolution details with appropriate default and custom reasons.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Provider` class, verifying its functionality for fetching various flag types (boolean, string, number, object). It specifically tests the provider's behavior when the OpenFeature evaluation engine is not configured or encounters errors during value retrieval.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Component` class. It verifies the component's initialization logic under various conditions, such as OpenFeature and remote configuration enablement, `libdatadog` availability, and Ruby engine, as well as its shutdown behavior.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Configuration::Settings` class. It specifically verifies the behavior of the `open_feature.enabled` setting, including its interaction with the `DD_EXPERIMENTAL_FLAGGING_PROVIDER_ENABLED` environment variable and direct assignment.
Defines the main module for Datadog's OpenFeature integration, including methods for checking its status and accessing its engine, and extending core configuration.

This file defines Ruby classes and modules that provide an interface for feature flag evaluation, relying on C extensions (libdatadog) for the core implementation. It handles the resolution details, including JSON parsing for object-type feature flag values.
This file defines constants representing various error and status types for OpenFeature extensions within the Datadog tracing library.
This file defines configuration settings for the OpenFeature integration within the Datadog Ruby tracer. It specifically manages an 'enabled' flag for an experimental flagging provider.
This file defines a native evaluator for OpenFeature feature flags, providing an interface to evaluate flags based on a given configuration and context, leveraging `libdatadog`.
This file defines the `ResolutionDetails` class, a data structure for storing the results of an OpenFeature feature flag resolution, including its value, reason, and any associated error information.

This file defines the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Component` class, which serves as the main entry point and orchestrator for integrating OpenFeature with the Datadog tracer. It handles initialization, configuration checks, and management of the OpenFeature evaluation engine and exposure reporting.

This file defines the `EvaluationEngine` class, which is responsible for evaluating OpenFeature flags based on a given configuration and context. It handles flag value retrieval, type validation, and dynamic reconfiguration of the underlying evaluation mechanism.

This file defines the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Provider` class, which implements an OpenFeature SDK provider. It enables applications to use Datadog's Remote Configuration as a feature flagging backend for OpenFeature evaluations.

This file defines a `NoopEvaluator` for Datadog OpenFeature, serving as a placeholder or fallback. It always returns the default value with an error, indicating that the feature flag configuration is not yet ready.

This file contains RSpec tests for `Datadog::Core::Remote::Configuration::ContentList` and `Datadog::Core::Remote::Configuration::Content`. It verifies the functionality of managing remote configuration content, including parsing, retrieval, modification, deletion, and tracking content state and hashes.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Remote::Configuration::Repository` class. It verifies the repository's transaction-based operations (set, insert, update, delete) for managing remote configuration contents and its state management, including cached target files.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Remote` component, verifying its ability to receive and process remote configuration changes related to feature flags (FFE_FLAGS) and reconfigure the OpenFeature evaluation engine accordingly.

This file implements the remote configuration integration for Datadog's OpenFeature module. It provides receivers to process remote updates for feature flag configurations and applies these changes directly to the OpenFeature evaluation engine.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Transport::HTTP` class, specifically verifying its `send_exposures` method. It covers scenarios for successful event posting and error handling during HTTP requests.
This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Exposures::Buffer` class, verifying its behavior regarding capacity limits, item dropping, and the `push`, `pop`, and `concat` methods.
This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Exposures::Reporter` class, verifying its functionality for reporting OpenFeature exposures, handling deduplication, and error scenarios.

This RSpec test file verifies the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Exposures::Event` class, ensuring it correctly builds OpenFeature exposure events, and generates appropriate cache keys and values based on evaluation results and context.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Exposures::Worker` class. It verifies the worker's functionality, including starting, enqueuing and flushing feature flag exposure events, and handling various transport responses and errors during their transmission.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::OpenFeature::Exposures::Deduplicator` class, ensuring it correctly identifies and prevents repeated reporting of OpenFeature exposures, including handling cache eviction.

This file defines the HTTP transport mechanism for sending OpenFeature exposure events to the Datadog Event Platform Intake. It encapsulates the specifics of API endpoints, request headers, and payload encoding for these events.
This file defines a `Deduplicator` class that uses an LRU cache to prevent duplicate exposure events. It stores previously seen key-value pairs and efficiently checks if a new event is a duplicate.
This file defines a Ruby buffer specifically for Datadog OpenFeature exposure events, which manages event storage, evicts items randomly when full, and tracks the number of dropped events.

This file defines the `Reporter` class, which is responsible for reporting OpenFeature flag evaluation details (exposures) to a backend agent. It includes deduplication logic and error handling for the reporting process.

This file defines a worker responsible for asynchronously collecting, batching, and sending OpenFeature exposure events to the Datadog Agent. It manages a queue of events, flushes them periodically, and handles graceful shutdown.

This file defines a data model for OpenFeature exposure events, providing methods to build the event structure, generate cache keys and values, and extract relevant attributes from the evaluation context.

This directory is intended to contain type signature files (RBS) specifically for defining how OpenFeature flag evaluations or contextual data are 'exposed' or represented within the Datadog Ruby tracer. It provides static type definitions related to the outputs or interfaces of the OpenFeature integration.

Error Tracking.description: Captures, groups, and analyzes application errors in real-time. It provides detailed context, including stack traces and links to correlated traces, to accelerate debugging and improve application stability.

files.description: This file contains benchmarks to measure the performance overhead of Datadog's error tracking feature under various configurations (e.g., tracking all errors, user errors, or third-party errors) and scenarios (with and without errors occurring).

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Error` class, verifying its functionality for capturing, formatting, and building error objects from various sources, including exceptions and custom messages.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Telemetry::Logger` class, verifying its behavior when reporting exceptions or errors. It checks that telemetry events are delegated to a telemetry component if configured, otherwise, a warning is logged.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Telemetry::Logging` module, verifying how exceptions and custom messages are reported via telemetry, including redaction of sensitive information and stack traces.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Core::Telemetry::Event::Log` class, verifying its functionality for creating telemetry log events, handling different log levels, and ensuring proper payload generation and object uniqueness.
Provides RSpec helper methods to conditionally skip error tracking tests based on the Ruby version or platform (JRuby).
Defines a module `Lib2` with a method that raises and then immediately rescues an error, likely for testing error handling within the `dd-trace-rb` library.

Defines a module `Lib1` with a method `rescue_error` that raises an exception and then immediately rescues it without further action. This file likely serves as a test fixture for error handling scenarios within the `datadog/error_tracking` context.

This file contains RSpec tests to validate 'Error Tracking' benchmarks by running them in a separate process and ensuring they don't raise errors. It also verifies that all existing benchmarks are included in the validation list.

This RSpec file tests the `Datadog::ErrorTracking::Component`, verifying its instantiation, configuration, and its ability to capture and report handled exceptions as span events under various scenarios and filtering settings.
This file defines a module `SubLib1` which includes a method `rescue_error` that raises an error and immediately rescues it, likely for testing or demonstrating error handling within a sub-library.
Defines a module `SubLib2` with a method `rescue_error` that raises and immediately rescues an error, likely for testing error handling within a sublibrary.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::Tracing::Metadata::Errors` module. It verifies that methods like `set_error` and `set_error_tags` correctly extract and assign error message, type, and stack trace metadata to an object for tracing.
Defines a mock Ruby client (`MockGem::Client`) with a method (`rescue_error`) that demonstrates raising and rescuing an error, likely for testing error handling scenarios.
This file provides utility functions for the `MockGem` library, specifically demonstrating error handling within the `MockGem::Utils` module.
This Rails controller defines an action for simulating server errors, likely for testing or demonstrating error handling and trace visibility within a Datadog integration environment.

This file contains RSpec tests for Datadog's error tracking configuration settings. It verifies how settings are applied programmatically, via environment variables, and ensures proper handling of default values and invalid inputs.
Defines the base configuration module for Datadog Error Tracking. It serves as an entry point for loading specific error tracking settings.
This file defines constants used by Datadog's error tracking feature. These constants include environment variables and predefined categories for classifying handled errors.
This file extends Datadog's core configuration settings with Error Tracking-specific features, allowing the Error Tracking configuration to be integrated into the global Datadog settings.
This file defines the configuration settings for Datadog's error tracking feature in the Ruby tracer, specifically for handling and reporting captured errors.
This file initializes and configures the Rollbar error monitoring service for the Rails application. It sets up the access token and other Rollbar-specific settings.
This file initializes the Rollbar error tracking library for a Rails 6 application, configuring it with a placeholder access token for integration testing.

This directory is a placeholder for `RBS` type signature files related to the configuration of Datadog's error tracking features within the `dd-trace-rb` Ruby gem. It defines the expected interfaces and data structures for setting up error tracking.
This file serves as the main entry point for the Datadog ErrorTracking module, loading its various components and activating its extensions to integrate with the global Datadog shared objects.

This file defines the `Datadog::Core::Error` class, a value object responsible for sanitizing and encapsulating error data from various sources into a standardized format, including generating detailed backtraces.

This file defines filtering logic for error tracking events, categorizing code paths as user, Datadog, or third-party to selectively report handled errors. It generates optimized filter procs based on configuration for efficient event processing.

This file defines the `Datadog::ErrorTracking::Component` class, which captures and reports handled exceptions using Ruby's TracePoint, filters them based on configured settings, and integrates with Datadog tracing by adding exception events to active spans.

This file defines the `Collector` class, responsible for collecting and managing error-related span events within a `SpanOperation` in Datadog's error tracking system, ensuring proper lifecycle management and reporting of exceptions.
This file defines a module for attaching error metadata to tracing spans. It provides methods to extract error type, message, and stack trace from an error object and set them as tags on a span.

This file defines a Rails middleware, `ExceptionMiddleware`, which catches exceptions within the Rails application stack to ensure they are properly recorded as errors on the active tracing span before Rails' own error handling might obscure them.

Defines the `Log` class for Datadog telemetry, representing a log event with message, level, stack trace, and count. It includes logic for level validation and object equality for deduplication purposes.

AI Guard & LLM Observability.description: Monitors and secures interactions with Large Language Models (LLMs). It provides observability into model prompts and responses, detects sensitive data, and helps protect against prompt injection attacks.

files.description: This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::AIGuard` module, verifying its configuration, API interactions, and message handling capabilities for AI Guard evaluations.
This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::AIGuard::APIClient` class, specifically verifying its `post` method's behavior across various HTTP response codes and network conditions.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::AIGuard::Evaluation` class. It verifies the behavior of the AI Guard evaluation logic, including span creation, tag setting, message handling, and blocking functionality based on AI Guard API responses.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::AIGuard::Component` class, specifically verifying the behavior of its `.build` method. It ensures the component is correctly initialized with an API client when AI Guard is enabled and returns `nil` when disabled.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::AIGuard::Evaluation::Result` class, verifying its ability to parse AI Guard evaluation responses and provide access to action, reason, tags, and blocking status.
This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::AIGuard::Evaluation::Message` class, primarily focusing on its constructor and validation of the `role` and `tool_call` arguments.

This RSpec file tests the `Datadog::AIGuard::Evaluation::Request` class, ensuring it correctly constructs and sends evaluation requests to the Datadog AI Guard API, and properly serializes various message types while respecting configured message limits.

This file serves as the main entry point and public interface for the Datadog AI Guard feature. It provides methods for evaluating messages with the AI Guard API and for constructing various types of message objects for evaluation.
This file defines constants related to Datadog's AI Guard feature, primarily used for naming spans and tags within the tracing system.

This file defines a module for performing AI Guard evaluations, which involves sending messages for analysis, tracing the evaluation process with relevant tags, and potentially blocking operations based on the AI Guard's decision.

This file defines the `APIClient` for interacting with the Datadog AI Guard API. It handles HTTP POST requests, authentication, error handling, and JSON parsing for communication with the AI Guard service.

This file defines the `Component` class for the Datadog AI Guard product. It acts as the central integration point, responsible for building and managing the API client used to interact with the AI Guard service.

This file defines the `Result` class which parses and encapsulates the response from the AI Guard evaluation API, providing methods to access evaluation actions (allow, deny, abort) and blocking status.
This file defines the `Message` class used within Datadog's AI Guard evaluation module. It encapsulates properties like role, content, and tool call information for AI-related messages.

Application Security Management (ASM).description: Detects and protects against application-level threats, such as SQL injection and cross-site scripting, by analyzing request patterns and application behavior. It provides real-time threat visibility and can block malicious actors.

files.description: This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::AppSec::CounterSampler` class, verifying its sampling logic and independent counting behavior.

This RSpec test file verifies the error handling and telemetry reporting mechanisms of the Datadog AppSec Rails Patcher when an error occurs during the processing of application routes.

This file contains RSpec integration tests for Datadog's Application Security (AppSec) and tracing features within a Rack-based Ruby application. It validates the behavior of AppSec rules, tracing middleware, and remote configuration in a Rack environment.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::AppSec::Contrib::Rack::Gateway::Response` class. It verifies that the class correctly encapsulates and provides access to HTTP response body, status, and headers within the Datadog AppSec Rack integration.

This RSpec file tests the `Datadog::AppSec::Contrib::Rack::Gateway::Request` class, ensuring it correctly parses and extracts various components of an HTTP request, such as query parameters, headers, URL details, cookies, and form data from a Rack environment.

This file contains RSpec integration tests for Datadog's Application Security (AppSec) module, verifying its functionality and behavior when integrated with Sinatra applications, including event detection and blocking.
This file conditionally enables and initializes Datadog Application Security (AppSec) auto-instrumentation if the `DD_APPSEC_ENABLED` environment variable is set to true.
This file defines the base module for Application Security (AppSec) instrumentation within the Datadog Ruby tracing library. It serves as a placeholder for AppSec-related instrumentation logic.

This file defines a module for automatically instrumenting all registered Datadog Application Security (AppSec) integrations that support auto-instrumentation. It iterates through available integrations and applies instrumentation to each.

This file defines a base module for registering and managing integrations within the Datadog AppSec Contrib namespace. It provides a mechanism to register integration classes and store them in a central registry.

This file defines a Rack middleware for Datadog Application Security (AppSec) specifically designed for integration with Rails applications. It provides the necessary middleware component to integrate AppSec functionalities into a Rails request processing pipeline.
This file defines the Datadog AppSec framework integration for Rails applications. It sets up instrumentation for Rack within the Datadog AppSec configuration.
This file defines the Datadog Application Security integration for Ruby on Rails. It handles version compatibility checks and provides the necessary components for patching the Rails framework.
This file provides utility methods for extracting and normalizing body and route parameters from a Rails `ActionDispatch::Request` object, primarily for Datadog AppSec purposes.

This file implements a patcher for Rails applications to integrate Datadog Application Security (AppSec) features. It adds necessary middleware, patches ActionController methods, and collects API endpoint information for security monitoring.

This file defines a Rails gateway watcher for Datadog AppSec, integrating the Web Application Firewall (WAF) with Rails request actions and JSON response bodies to detect and respond to security threats.

This file defines a `Request` class that wraps a Rails `ActionDispatch::Request` object, providing methods to extract and normalize specific request data (like headers, body, and route parameters) for use within the Datadog Application Security gateway instrumentation.

This file patches the `process_action` method in Rails' `ActionController::Instrumentation` to integrate with Datadog AppSec. It intercepts requests, pushing them through the AppSec gateway for security analysis and monitoring.
This patch for Rails' `render_to_body` method captures JSON response bodies before serialization. It is used by Datadog AppSec to monitor and analyze the content of JSON responses.

This file defines the Datadog AppSec integration for the Faraday gem, handling version compatibility checks and providing the necessary patching mechanism to instrument Faraday requests for security monitoring.

This file defines the Datadog Application Security (AppSec) integration for the Devise gem. It registers the integration, checks for Devise compatibility, and specifies the patcher responsible for instrumenting Devise functionalities for security monitoring.

This file integrates Datadog AppSec with GraphQL by intercepting the `execute_multiplex` method. It pushes GraphQL multiplex data to the AppSec gateway for security analysis without generating new traces.

This file defines the Datadog Application Security (AppSec) integration for the GraphQL library. It includes methods for checking GraphQL version compatibility, verifying loaded status, and providing the associated patcher.

This file defines a Patcher module for Datadog Application Security (AppSec) to integrate with GraphQL. It instruments GraphQL schemas to enable security tracing and watches gateway events, conditionally loading features based on the installed `graphql` gem version.

This file defines the `Multiplex` class, which processes GraphQL multiplex queries. Its primary function is to extract and normalize arguments from these queries, including field arguments and directives, for use in application security (AppSec) analysis.

This file defines a watcher that monitors GraphQL multiplex events in the Datadog AppSec gateway. It integrates the Web Application Firewall (WAF) to analyze GraphQL resolver arguments and applies security actions if threats are detected.

This file defines the Datadog AppSec integration for ActiveRecord, including version compatibility checks and a reference to its patching mechanism. It manages the setup and configuration for instrumenting ActiveRecord within the AppSec module.

This file provides AppSec (Application Security) patching logic for various ActiveRecord database adapters (SQLite3, MySQL2, PostgreSQL) by dynamically prepending instrumentation modules based on the ActiveRecord version and loading state.

This file implements a Datadog AppSec instrumentation for ActiveRecord queries, detecting SQL injection vulnerabilities across various ActiveRecord versions and database adapters. It intercepts database queries to analyze them for malicious patterns using Datadog's WAF and RASP capabilities.
This file defines the Datadog AppSec integration for Rack applications, handling version compatibility checks and registering the Rack patcher.
This file defines constants listing HTTP request headers that the Datadog Application Security Rack integration should collect for analysis or identification purposes.
This file defines a Rack middleware for Datadog AppSec, designed to process request bodies and integrate with the AppSec gateway for security analysis and potential interruption.
This file defines the `Patcher` module for the Datadog AppSec Rack integration. It provides methods to apply necessary patches and start monitoring Rack requests.

This file defines a Rack middleware for Datadog AppSec that intercepts incoming requests to apply security analysis, enrich traces with AppSec-specific tags, and handle potential security-based request interruptions.

This file defines the `Response` class, which represents a Rack HTTP response within the Datadog AppSec Gateway context. It encapsulates response body, status, and headers for processing and instrumentation.
This file defines the `Request` class, which serves as a gateway argument for extracting and normalizing HTTP request data from a Rack environment for AppSec purposes.
This file defines a Rack gateway watcher for Datadog AppSec, subscribing to various Rack request and response events to apply WAF (Web Application Firewall) rules and report security events.

This file defines a Rack middleware for Datadog Application Security (AppSec) specifically designed for Sinatra applications. It integrates AppSec functionality into the request-response cycle of Sinatra web services.
This file provides framework-specific code for integrating Datadog AppSec with Sinatra applications, primarily by setting up Rack instrumentation.
This file defines the Datadog AppSec integration for the Sinatra web framework. It includes version compatibility checks and specifies the associated patcher for instrumenting Sinatra applications.

This file provides a patcher module to integrate Datadog Application Security (AppSec) functionality into the Sinatra web framework. It modifies Sinatra's request processing, middleware setup, and route handling to enable AppSec monitoring and security features.
This file defines a patch for the `Sinatra::JSON#json` method to intercept and capture the JSON response body for Datadog Application Security (AppSec) analysis before serialization.

This file defines a Sinatra-specific gateway request class for Datadog AppSec. It inherits from the Rack gateway request and is responsible for normalizing and extracting data from Rack requests within the Sinatra integration.

This file defines a Sinatra gateway event watcher for Datadog AppSec. It monitors various Sinatra request and response events, runs a Web Application Firewall (WAF) against relevant data, and handles any security findings.
This file defines the integration for Datadog AppSec with the Excon HTTP client library. It manages compatibility checks and provides the `Patcher` class responsible for instrumentation.
This file defines the Datadog Application Security (AppSec) integration for the `rest-client` Ruby gem, specifying its version compatibility and linking to the relevant instrumentation patcher.
This file implements an instrumentation gateway for Datadog AppSec, enabling the registration and execution of middleware chains for specific events and tracking their occurrences.

This file defines base and specific argument classes for the Datadog AppSec instrumentation gateway, including `User` and `DataContainer` for passing user and arbitrary data to the event system, noting they are slated for refactoring.

This file defines a middleware class for the Datadog AppSec instrumentation gateway, encapsulating a callable block for instrumentation logic. It acts as a wrapper for instrumentation within the gateway, though it is noted as deprecated.
This initializer configures parameters to be filtered from Rails application logs, preventing sensitive information like passwords and tokens from being exposed.

This directory is designated to hold type signature definitions (e.g., Sorbet) for the Datadog Application Security (AppSec) integration with the Faraday HTTP client within the Ruby tracing library. It defines the expected types and interfaces for this specific contribution.

This directory is intended to hold type signature (RBS) files for the Datadog AppSec integration with the `rest_client` gem within the Ruby tracing library. It defines the expected types for AppSec-related code interacting with `rest_client`.

This directory is designated to store type signature definitions for the Datadog Application Security integration with the Excon HTTP client, part of the `dd-trace-rb` project. Its role is to enable static type checking for this specific contribution. As it is currently empty, it serves as a placeholder or indicates that type signatures for this integration have not yet been defined or are not present.

This directory contains type signature definitions for patches applied to the Sinatra web framework. These patches are part of Datadog's Application Security (AppSec) contributions for Ruby, ensuring type-safe integration with Sinatra applications.

This directory is intended to hold Sorbet type signatures (RBI files) for the Datadog Application Security (AppSec) gateway integration with the Sinatra web framework. It defines the type contracts for how Sinatra applications interact with AppSec features.

This directory contains Ruby type signatures (RBS files) for the Datadog AppSec integration within the `dd-trace-rb` library. Specifically, it defines types related to the GraphQL contribution, particularly for gateway-level interactions. It ensures type safety for the GraphQL gateway components of the AppSec module.

This directory is intended to contain Ruby Signature (RBS) files. These signatures would define the type interfaces for patches applied to the Devise authentication gem within Datadog's Application Security integration. Its purpose is to ensure type safety and allow static analysis of these specific modifications.

This directory is intended to house type signature files for patches applied to the Ruby on Rails framework within the Datadog Application Security (AppSec) integration. These signatures would define the types for the AppSec-related modifications made to Rails, ensuring type safety and aiding development.

This directory is intended to contain Ruby type signatures (RBS files) specifically for the gateway-related components of the Datadog Application Security (AppSec) integration with the Rails framework, as part of the Datadog Ruby tracer.

This directory is intended to contain type signature definitions for the Application Security (AppSec) module's integration with the Rack web server interface. Specifically, it would house type definitions related to the gateway components that mediate AppSec interactions within a Rack environment.

This directory is intended to contain type signatures (e.g., RBS files) for the gateway component of the Application Security (AppSec) monitor within the Datadog Ruby tracing library. It defines the expected interfaces and data structures for interacting with the AppSec monitoring gateway.

This directory is intended to house Ruby type signatures (RBS files) for the 'gateway' component within Datadog's Application Security (AppSec) instrumentation. Its purpose is to enable static type checking and improve code quality for this specific part of the AppSec integration in the `dd-trace-rb` library.

Data Streams Monitoring.description: Tracks and visualizes data flows through distributed systems, such as message queues and streaming platforms like Kafka. It monitors the health and latency of data pipelines from end to end.

files.description: This file defines RSpec helpers for Data Streams Monitoring, providing methods to conditionally skip tests based on platform compatibility (e.g., JRuby, TruffleRuby, macOS) and the availability of the DDSketch library.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::DataStreams::PathwayContext` class, verifying its base64 encoding and decoding functionality, including handling various data ranges, edge cases, and invalid inputs.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::DataStreams::Processor` class, verifying its functionality in tracking data stream pathways, computing hashes for checkpoints, handling propagation, and aggregating latency metrics using DDSketch.

This file contains RSpec tests for the Data Streams configuration settings in the Datadog Ruby tracer, verifying how 'enabled' and 'interval' properties are read from environment variables and set programmatically.

This file contains RSpec tests for the `Datadog::DataStreams::Transport::Stats` class, specifically its `Transport` component. It verifies that data stream statistics are correctly serialized, compressed, and sent through the transport layer.

This RSpec test file verifies the correct initialization and configuration of the HTTP transport for Datadog's Data Streams feature. It specifically tests the `.default` method's ability to set up the transport with various agent settings, HTTP headers, API endpoints, and different underlying adapters like Net::HTTP and Unix sockets.
This file defines the base module for Data Streams Monitoring configuration within the Datadog tracer, including related settings.

This file defines the `PathwayContext` class, which represents a context for monitoring data streams within Datadog. It includes methods for encoding and decoding pathway context information to and from base64 strings, utilizing custom variable-length integer encoding for efficient serialization.
This file defines constants related to Data Streams Monitoring configuration within the Datadog Ruby tracer, such as the environment variable for enabling the feature.

This file defines the `Processor` class for Datadog Data Streams Monitoring, which collects and processes data stream events and periodically reports aggregated pathway statistics to the Datadog agent.

This file defines an extension module for Data Streams monitoring, specifically responsible for injecting Data Streams-related configuration settings into the global Datadog configuration when activated.
This file defines the configuration settings for Datadog's Data Streams Monitoring, including options for enabling the feature and setting the stats flush interval.

This file defines the HTTP transport mechanism for sending Data Streams pipeline statistics to the Datadog agent. It configures a default HTTP client with specific headers and an API endpoint for pipeline stats.
This file defines the transport mechanism for sending Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) statistics. It handles MessagePack encoding, gzip compression, and sending the stats payload to the Datadog agent.
This file defines the HTTP transport classes for sending Data Streams Metrics (DSM) statistics, including a custom response handler and an API endpoint for POST requests.

This directory is intended to house type signatures (e.g., Sorbet sig files) specifically for the configuration aspects of the `data_streams` feature within the Datadog Ruby tracer. It defines the expected types and structure for how data stream functionalities are configured.

This directory is intended to contain type signatures (`.rbs` files) for the HTTP transport components used by the Datadog Data Streams feature within the Ruby tracer. It defines the expected interfaces and data structures for HTTP-based communication related to data streams.

This RSpec file tests the `Datadog::Tracing::Contrib::Aws::Service::Kinesis` class, specifically its `add_tags` method. It verifies how AWS Kinesis stream names and account IDs are extracted from request parameters (stream_arn or stream_name) and applied as tags to a trace span.

This file contains RSpec integration tests for the Datadog Kafka tracing integration, verifying its version detection, loading logic, compatibility with 'ruby-kafka', auto-instrumentation, default configuration, and associated patcher.

This file contains RSpec tests for Datadog's Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) instrumentation for Kafka. It verifies that pathway context is correctly injected by producers, processed by consumers, and that the instrumentation respects DSM's enabled/disabled state.

This file contains RSpec tests for the Datadog Kafka integration's patcher, verifying that various Kafka operations are correctly traced with appropriate span details and error handling. It tests tracing for connection requests, consumer batch processing, and individual message processing.

This file contains RSpec tests for Datadog's Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) integration with the Karafka message broker. It verifies automatic pathway context extraction and propagation, batch processing, and behavior when DSM is disabled.

This file contains RSpec tests for the Datadog tracing integration with Karafka's monitor. It verifies that Karafka events, particularly consumer job processing, are correctly instrumented and traced with appropriate span details and tags.

This file contains RSpec tests for the Datadog tracing middleware for the WaterDrop Kafka client. It verifies correct distributed tracing context propagation and DataStreams integration when producing messages.
This file provides the public API for Datadog's Data Streams Monitoring, allowing users to set produce and consume checkpoints and track Kafka message offsets for distributed data flow observation.

This file serves as the main entry point for Datadog's tracing integration with the `WaterDrop` gem. It provides methods for injecting and extracting distributed trace context for messages and registers the `WaterDrop` integration component.
This file defines the `ConsumerEvent` module for Datadog's Kafka tracing integration, providing logic to tag spans with consumer-specific metadata like group ID and span kind during event processing.

This file defines how Datadog tracing spans are enriched for Kafka-related ActiveSupport::Notifications events, setting tags for client ID, messaging system, and applying analytics configuration. It integrates Kafka operations with the Datadog tracing library in Ruby.
This file defines basic instrumentation behaviors for Kafka consumer group events. It sets the Datadog span's resource name to the consumer group ID when an event starts.

This file instruments `Kafka::Producer` methods like `deliver_messages` and `send_messages` to integrate with Datadog Data Streams. It adds data stream checkpoints to Kafka message headers during production for end-to-end tracing and monitoring.
This file instruments the `Kafka::Consumer`'s `each_message` and `each_batch` methods to enable Datadog Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) by setting consume checkpoints for Kafka messages and batches.

This file defines the instrumentation for the `send_messages.producer.kafka` event within Datadog Tracing for Kafka, setting relevant tags like message counts and marking the span as a producer operation.

This file defines Datadog tracing instrumentation for the `process_batch.consumer.kafka` event, capturing details like topic, message count, and partition when a Kafka consumer processes a batch of messages.

This file defines a custom Datadog monitor for Karafka, a Ruby Kafka framework. It instruments Karafka worker processing events to generate traces, capture relevant metadata, and track consumer offsets for data streams monitoring.

This file integrates Datadog tracing with WaterDrop producers. It automatically traces message production methods and adds relevant metadata like topics, partitions, and message count to the Datadog spans.
This file defines a middleware for WaterDrop to integrate Datadog tracing and data streams. It injects tracing context and sets data stream checkpoints into WaterDrop message headers for propagation.
This file defines the base class for all Action Cable channels within the Rails application, providing a common foundation for real-time communication.
This controller handles the creation and queuing of background jobs using Resque, specifically enqueuing a `TestJob` and returning its ID.

This directory contains type signatures (RBS files) related to Datadog tracing integration for Kafka consumer group events in the Ruby tracer. It defines the expected types and interfaces for instrumenting and interacting with Kafka consumer groups.

This directory is intended to house type signatures (RBS files) specifically for tracing Kafka produce operations within the Datadog Ruby tracer. It defines the types associated with events generated when messages are produced to Kafka topics.
